page.title: 04Birdlife near New Deer
page.content: The buildings and the garden at {South Mains of Auchmaliddie}are surrounded by plenty of trees of several species, providing cover for a number of bird. Residents and regular nesting species are{sparrow, starling, thrush, {blackbird, robin, bluetit, chaffinch, {wren,pied wagtail, spotted flycatcher, {swallow, greenfinch, feral pigeon, {woodpigeon, and carrion crow. Tawny {owl and sparrow hawk}visit the garden. Regular sightings are made of the following birds in the fields;{rook, {black-headed and common gulls,jackdaw, {lapwing, pheasant, partridge, curlew, {oyster catcher,yellow hammer, magpie, {kestrel and short-eared owl. { Teal, mallard and geese}are seen flying overhead and very occasionally a{heron or swan}is sighted.
